abstract: Nationwide effort is underway to use so-called basket studies, which lump different kinds of cancer patients together to test efficacy of cancer drugs that block gene mutations rather than treat organ where disease originated; researchers say this new potentially revolutionary method, which is much faster to implement than traditional studies, could help treat seriously ill patients quicker by speeding up drug's approval process.
lead_paragraph: So-called basket studies, which group cancer patients in a new way, could revolutionize the path from the lab to F.D.A. approval and market success.

headline.main: A Faster Way to Try Many Drugs on Many Cancers
headline.print_headline: Fast Way to Try Many Drugs on Many Cancers

snippet: So-called basket studies, which group cancer patients in a new way, could revolutionize the path from the lab to F.D.A. approval and market success.
